Considering the limited plasticity of moult timing in weasels and further climate warming leading to decreasing snow cover, we suppose that M. n. nivalis could disappear from some areas and be entirely replaced by M. n. vulgaris. Adaptive evolution of moulting time in M. n. nivalis is also further constrained by the fact that the decreasing number of days with snow cover is not only caused by the overall shortening of winter, but also by a substantial increase in the frequency of mid-winter snow-free periods. Therefore, even if weasels are able to modify their response to photoperiod
27 , they are unable to reverse the progress of moulting when weather conditions change during winter.
